reviewText: I thought this would be fun. Instead, the plot staggers from cliché to cliché--star-crossed lovers, honest fisher folk with mandolins, nasty Nazis, spy circles with a variety of subjugated nations represented, roulette wheels, traitors, shoot-outs, lots of fog. The dialog is beyond preposterous, and Paul Henreid dashes around like a waiter on a busy night. For once he doesn't give his character depth or interest; maybe he didn't have time. Hedy Lamarr's famous "poker-face" style doesn't help; her many costumes are gorgeous, though, and Edeson's camera work is excellent. Steiner's music is only so-so. Go back to Casablanca.
Title: N/A

reviewText: After allegedly missing out on playing Ilsa in Casablanca, Hedy Lamarr was cast in this wartime resistance tale.  Surrounded by many of the same cast including Sydney Greenstreet and Peter Lorre, you would think the story would be stronger.  Unfortunately the plot is a little weak and the film is more of a vehicle for Paul Henreid.  If you are a fan of either Lamarr or Henreid you will want to see it, but set your expectations a little low and you will probably enjoy seeing them together as much as the film itself.  Lamarr is at the peak of her glamour and Henreid gets to be the hero and not the "other man" like in Casablanca.  There are some good scenes including a jailbreak and shootout, but for the most part it is not more than an okay film.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Love to watch this movie.  I love the stars in it, and I love to watch the entire story line unfold before me!  Love this movie!!Rhonda

reviewText: CASABLANCA comes closest to mind when you watch this 1944 film filled with intrigue and romance.  Some of the characters from the 1942 Bogart film appear in this beautifully shot b&w; film like Peter Lorre and Sydney Greenstreet altho Victor Francen practically steals the show.  If its suspense you want in a foreign locale, THE CONSPIRATOS is for you, and purchase it at amazon.com.Dr. Ron Schwartz, Manhattan
summary: Gorgeous Hedy Lamarr and handsome Paul Henried give the Gestapo a run for their money in THE CONSPIRATORS
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a film made 2 years after Casablanca, with much of the same cast, minus Humphrey Bogart and Ingrid Bergman. Paul Henreid is a saboteur escaping from the Nazis via Portugal.The movie is in the original black and white, which is fine, the picture quality is good. What isn't good is the sound. There are no subtitles and at points it is almost impossible to understand everything Henreid, with his tight lips is saying. Much of the other dialogue is soft and muted then the background/mood music is loud and alarms, sirens and gunshots are earsplitting.It's difficult to appreciate a movie when the dialogue is as vague as the plot.
Title: N/A
